item.title: Agent Toolkits: MultiON MultiON recently came out of stealth, and has shown impressive long-horizon agent planning / execution: https://x.com/DivGarg9...
item.description:
Agent Toolkits: MultiON

MultiON recently came out of stealth, and has shown impressive long-horizon agent planning / execution:

https://x.com/DivGarg9/status/1747683043446579416?s=20

It's absolutely worth trying as an agent that can perform open-ended tasks. And if you already have workflows using LangChain… https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748404710686785629


Div Garg: We just solved the long-horizon planning & execution issue with Agents 🤯!

Excited to announce that @MultiON_AI can now take actions well over 500+ steps without loosing context & cross-operate on 10+ websites as part of a single task 🤩!!

Our latest upgrade cracks the goal… https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1747683043446579416

item.title: 🔎 Structured Outputs with Google Gemini One of the killer features of OpenAI models is function calling - which allows you to structure the respons...
item.description:
🔎 Structured Outputs with Google Gemini

One of the killer features of OpenAI models is function calling - which allows you to structure the responses of the LLM.

Google Gemini supports the same type of function calling - and we've now added a chain to make it super easy in… https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748403680423117309

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: 🌲 Pinecone Serverless 🤝 LangChain JS 🌲 You can now use brand new @pinecone serverless vectorstores with @LangChainAI 🦜🔗 J...
item.description:
RT Jacob Lee
🌲 Pinecone Serverless 🤝 LangChain JS 🌲

You can now use brand new @pinecone serverless vectorstores with @LangChainAI 🦜🔗 JS/TS via a new integration package!

It supports all the latest features, plus existing indexes.

Thank you @zackproser:

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/vectorstores/pinecone
item.author: LangChain

RT AI Makerspace
Are you ready to demystify evaluating RAG applications?

Join us on Wed. Feb. 7 at 10 AM PT for the deep dive on the black art of RAG eval you’ve been waiting for!

Special thanks to @LangChainAI and RAGAS for partnering with us on this event!

item.title: RT Brace: 🦜🕸️LangGraph JS Released LangGraph makes it easy to modify agent runtimes with @LangChainAI. So far in JS we have a couple examples t...
item.description:
RT Brace
🦜🕸️LangGraph JS Released

LangGraph makes it easy to modify agent runtimes with @LangChainAI. So far in JS we have a couple examples to help you get started:

🤖Example of replicating the LangChain AgentExecutor
📷A chat agent executor (aimed specifically at chat models)

Super… https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748085262218055790

item.title: RT Plotly: Congratulations to Troy Scribner, the first-place winner of the Plotly-LangChain Community App Challenge! 🥇 Troy created StockNews, comb...
item.description:
RT Plotly
Congratulations to Troy Scribner, the first-place winner of the Plotly-LangChain Community App Challenge! 🥇

Troy created StockNews, combining Plotly Dash with @LangChainAI and @ChatGPTapp to answer questions about current stock market news for companies in the S&P500. The app… https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1748069001677402117
item.author: LangChain

item.title: RT Tomaz Bratanic: LLMs can be brittle at generating Cypher, even if you use GPT-4. In my latest blog post, I have written about ensuring robustness o...
item.description:
RT Tomaz Bratanic
LLMs can be brittle at generating Cypher, even if you use GPT-4. In my latest blog post, I have written about ensuring robustness of LLMs interacting with a knowledge graph through the implementation of semantic layers with @LangChainAI and @neo4j.

https://medium.com/towards-data-science/enhancing-interaction-between-language-models-and-graph-databases-via-a-semantic-layer-0a78ad3eba49
item.author: LangChain

item.title: ♠️SPADE: Synthesizing Assertions for Large Language Model Pipelines SPADE analyzes prompt version histories to create candidate assertion functions ...
item.description:
♠️SPADE: Synthesizing Assertions for Large Language Model Pipelines

SPADE analyzes prompt version histories to create candidate assertion functions and then selects a minimal set that fulfills both coverage and accuracy requirements.

https://arxiv.org/abs/2401.03038
item.author: LangChain
